name: Jean-Baptiste Cutting
descriptions: Jean-Baptiste Cutting is the head of security for the Mojave Wasteland branch of the Van Graffs weapons empire. He is Gloria Van Graff's half-brother and her right-hand man, living at the Silver Rush weapon shop in Freeside in 2281.

Around 2281, Cutting has taken on the role of an enforcer, becoming the backbone of the Van Graff family security forces. He works in the Silver Rush alongside his half-sister, Gloria, who he refers to as "Glory" and does his part in the politics of their operations in the only way he knows how; with the barrel of his laser rifle. He has Cutting as a surname, as opposed to Van Graff because his mother liked his father so much that she wanted Jean-Baptiste to have his father's last name.

topics.response_text: Well, looks like you came through after all. She's not half bad looking, is she? It's almost a shame...
All right then. If we're going to work together, there's only one thing you need to know about me. I like things simple.

topics.topic_text: What would I have to do?
topics.response_text: No, no, no. That's not how it works. You don't get to weigh the options. You're either in or you're out.
Yeah, sure fucking thing. I'll be waiting with baited breath for your schedule to clear up, ha ha.
I thought so. Come back when you've got a backbone.
Her name's Rose of Sharon Cassidy. That's some fancy shit, right?{Beat, to himself}Don't know what her mother was thinking with a name like that.

topics.topic_text: Do you know where she is?
topics.response_text: Fuck, no. If I knew where this bitch was, do you think I'd be asking you?
Find her, bring her back here so we can talk. Needless to say, there's some good money in it for you.
Then go bother someone else. I got shit to do.
You already agreed to take the job, asshole. There's no backing out now.
<Jean-Baptiste just stares at you.>
Guess I don't have to worry about talking with her, then. About fucking time. Any longer and I was gonna track you both down.
Well work fucking faster. I don't like thinking there's someone out there that hates me more than I hate them.

topics.topic_text: I heard your family has a grudge against a King named Pacer.
topics.response_text: Yeah, you can blame Glory for that mess. She had some fun with the little prick and it ended badly.

topics.topic_text: I was thinking of raiding his jet stash.
topics.response_text: Ha, he's a jet junkie? He'll go crazy when he finds it gone. I like it.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you just kill him?
topics.response_text: We could do that, but then we'd have to kill his four hundred friends too, and that'd just get tiring.
I'm not one for running a business. Never really had a head for numbers or smooth-talk. My talents are a little more... direct.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about the Van Graffs.
topics.response_text: Our family comes from Redding, to the west. We deal weapons mostly, but trade other commodities, like gold, if there's cash in it.
We're a wild bunch. There's my sister Frieda, who used to run this branch but took off to pursue "the opportunity of a lifetime", as she put it.
Make it quick. I got shit to do.
Glory? Glory's fucking{heavyily stressed}crazy.

topics.topic_text: How come your last name isn't Van Graff?
topics.response_text: Unlike most of my brothers and sisters, Mama didn't get sick of my father and get rid of him. He died right before I was born.

topics.topic_text: I've changed my mind. I'm not going to do it.
topics.response_text: That's just fucking great. I knew you didn't have what it takes from the start, but would Glory listen to me? No.

topics.topic_text: I thought you said I didn't have to kill her.
topics.response_text: Yeah, if you brought her back here. Is she behind you or something? 'Cause I don't see her.
{Eager}Waited too long to finish this, last loose end, all wrapped up.
{Scoffs}Really. We'll see about that.

topics.topic_text: [Terrifying Presence] Raise that gun, and I'll kill everyone in here.
topics.response_text: {Pauses, a little uneasy}You know what, I think you mean that. All right... maybe...
Dead?{Beat}What... by you?{Beat, admiring}Yeah, I can tell, you had something to do with it.

topics.topic_text: Cass? She's in the Mojave Outpost.
topics.response_text: {Chews it over}Really. NCR all around her.

topics.topic_text: I doubt Cass will listen to anything I have to say.
topics.response_text: {Slight mockery}What? You two on the outs? Ain't that a shame.

topics.topic_text: Do you know where she is?
topics.response_text: Fuck, no. If I knew where this bitch was, do you think I'd be asking you?

topics.topic_text: Is it because the Van Graffs attacked her caravan?
topics.response_text: {Frowns}I had nothing to do with that, and neither did anyone here. Now where would you have gotten an idea like that?
I got business here, need to watch the shop, make sure things are running - smoothly.

topics.topic_text: Anything you can say to her, you can say to me.
topics.response_text: {Cold, angry that player is challenging him}You don't want{emph}us chatting, trust me.{Smooths out}As for the girl - I just want to talk to her.

topics.topic_text: What did you want to talk to her about?
topics.response_text: {Irritated}If your answer isn't "yes, I'll bring her here" or "no, I won't, cause Gloria had me pegged wrong," then we're done here.
So, looks like we have us a thief. All right, guess I'm talking to you instead of the girl.

topics.topic_text: Found out from investigating the wreckage.
topics.response_text: And after all the trouble I went through to kill all those witnesses. Guess now I have one more than I thought.
Nowhere's a strange place to get an idea like that.

topics.topic_text: I'm not doing this for you.
topics.response_text: {Frowns}Guess Gloria was wrong about you, then. Get out of here, you're no use to me.

topics.topic_text: Forget it, I'll bring her here.
topics.response_text: Good, getting tired of questions from you when I should be getting answers. Bring her here.

conversation.response_text: Hi, I'm Jean-Baptiste, and you're about to stop being a pain in my ass.
Ha ha, I think he wet himself before he left. That was pretty good making up that part about sleeping with Jacob.
